heading: cisco beats earnings estimates
subheading: the networking equipment maker surpasses first-quarter profit projections, but just barely.
author: reuters
text: cisco systems' fiscal first-quarter profit topped analyst forecasts by a penny as the world's largest maker of data networking equipment increased sales to internet service providers. the company said tuesday that for the period ended 30 october, profit before one-time items rose to us$837 million, or 24 cents a share, from $561 million, or 17 cents, a year ago. sales rose 49 percent to 3.88 billion from $2.60 billion.the results topped consensus estimates of 23 cents a share, according to first call/thomson financial. "the internet continues to be a powerful force fueling the global economy," said john chambers, chief executive of cisco in a statement.the san jose, california-based company's sales also topped analyst revenue consensus estimates of nearly $3.8 billion, according to first call. but the results matched the so-called whisper number circulated among traders of 24 cents.including a one-time charge of $381 million, or $0.11 per share on an after-tax basis, cisco had net income of $438 million, or 13 cents a share, compared with $512 million, or 15 cents, a year ago.cisco stock rose 2 to 76-1/4 in trading after market close, which was before cisco released its results. in regular trading on the nasdaq, cisco stock fell 1-1/16 to 74-1/4.copyright* 1999 reuters limited.*
